meanings.definition: To make something mobile or capable of movement.
meanings.sent1: She mobilises the toys on the floor for her little brother to play with.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew mobilises the heavy machinery to start building the new road.
meanings.sent3: The wind mobilises the leaves into a swirling dance around the yard.
meanings.sent4: His speech mobilises the audience to stand up for what they believe in.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk mobilises the team's determination to win the game.

meanings.definition: To assemble or organize for a purpose.
meanings.sent1: They mobilise the volunteers to help clean up the park every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The event planner mobilises the staff to set up the decorations for the party.
meanings.sent3: The ants mobilise their forces to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The teacher mobilises the students into groups for a class project.
meanings.sent5: The team captain mobilises the players for a strategy meeting before the match.

meanings.definition: To prepare for action or use.
meanings.sent1: The army mobilises its troops for a mission in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: She mobilises her resources to start her own business.
meanings.sent3: The chef mobilises the ingredients to create a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter mobilises the equipment to put out the blazing fire.
meanings.sent5: The student mobilises their notes to study for the upcoming exam.
